statusKey.blocked: Waiting on a prerequisite or external dependency
statusKey.skipped: Intentionally deferred or removed from scope

features.title: Create portfolio case study card component
features.description: Build a reusable CaseStudyCard component that displays a hero screenshot, project name, brief description, technology/scope tags, and a link to the live site. Must follow the Editorial Brutalist design system (amber/zinc palette, Unbounded headings, hover effects).
validationCriteria: Component renders with all props: image, title, description, tags array, liveUrl
Responsive: full-width on mobile, works in 2-column grid on desktop
Hover effect present (subtle scale, border glow, or similar)
Typography uses Unbounded for title, Libre Baskerville for description
Tags styled as existing pill/tag pattern from design system
Live site link opens in new tab
Image uses Next.js Image component with proper sizing
features.postImplementationNotes: Component already implemented with all required props (image, title, description, tags, liveUrl). Uses group hover for coordinated effects (image scale, title color, border glow). Server component — no client JS. Tags use existing pill pattern. Build passes.

features.title: Prepare portfolio screenshots
features.description: Capture or prepare hero screenshots for all 4 portfolio projects. Aviation Expeditions and Sven's Hostel have existing images that may need reformatting. Ovens Soccer has ovens-new.jpg that needs verification. Kingdom Property Care needs a fresh screenshot. All images should be ~1200x800px landscape JPG/WebP.
validationCriteria: All 4 screenshot images exist in public/images/
Images are landscape ratio (~1200x800px or similar)
Images are optimized (under 500KB each)
Each image clearly shows the client site's homepage
Images look sharp and professional at card display size
features.postImplementationNotes: All 4 card images created at 1200x800px JPG. Aviation Expeditions (126KB) and Kingdom Property Care (461KB) captured via browser screenshots from live sites. Sven's Basecamp (240KB) derived from existing svens-after.jpg (live site unreachable). Ovens Soccer (139KB) derived from existing ovens-new.jpg. All under 500KB, landscape, clearly showing each client's homepage hero.

features.title: Rewrite portfolio page with case study card grid

Display all 4 projects: Aviation Expeditions, Sven's Basecamp Hostel, Ovens Soccer, Kingdom Property Care. Grid should be 1 column on mobile, 2 columns on desktop. Keep the hero section and CTA section.

CTA section retained at bottom

No broken images or links
npm run build succeeds without errors

features.title: Update homepage featured portfolio section
features.description: Replace the current homepage portfolio section (which uses BeforeAfterSlider components) with 2-3 featured case study cards matching the new portfolio page design. Should entice visitors to click through to the full portfolio page.
validationCriteria: Homepage shows 2-3 featured project cards (not before/after sliders)
Cards link to portfolio page or to live client sites
'View All Projects' or similar CTA links to /portfolio
Section heading and label follow existing design patterns
Layout is responsive and consistent with portfolio page grid
npm run build succeeds without errors

features.title: Clean up BeforeAfterSlider usage
features.description: After portfolio and homepage are updated, evaluate BeforeAfterSlider component. If no longer used anywhere, either remove it or keep it for potential future use. Remove any unused before/after image imports.
validationCriteria: No page imports BeforeAfterSlider unless intentionally kept
No unused image imports remain in page files
If component is removed, no references to it exist anywhere
If component is kept, it's clearly documented as available for future use
npm run build succeeds without errors or warnings about unused imports

features.title: Integrate FormSubmit.co with contact form
features.description: Replace the current console.log form submission in the contact page with FormSubmit.co integration. The form should POST to https://formsubmit.co/hello@woodswebsites.com. Configure hidden fields for: _subject (email subject template), _captcha (disable or use honeypot), _next (redirect URL after submission). Maintain the existing form UI, validation, and loading states.
validationCriteria: Form submits to FormSubmit.co endpoint
Honeypot spam field is included (hidden from users)
Custom subject line configured (e.g., 'New inquiry from Woods Websites')
After submission, user sees success feedback (redirect or in-page message)
Form validation still works (required fields, email format)
Loading state still displays during submission
Error handling for failed submissions
Test submission received at hello@woodswebsites.com

features.title: Add global metadata defaults in root layout
features.description: Add a base metadata export to app/layout.tsx with site-wide defaults: site name, default title template, default description, default Open Graph config, Twitter card config, and base URL. Individual pages will override these with page-specific metadata.
validationCriteria: layout.tsx exports a metadata object with: title template, description, openGraph defaults, twitter defaults
Title template follows pattern: '%s | Woods Websites'
Default description is compelling and includes key terms
openGraph includes: siteName, locale, type
twitter card type set to 'summary_large_image'
metadataBase is set to the production URL
npm run build succeeds

features.title: Add per-page metadata for all pages
features.description: Add unique metadata exports to each page: Homepage, Portfolio, Services, About, Contact. Each page gets a unique title, description, and Open Graph properties. Descriptions should be keyword-relevant and compelling for search results.
validationCriteria: Each page exports a metadata object with unique title and description
Titles are concise (under 60 characters)
Descriptions are compelling and under 160 characters
Open Graph title and description set per page
No duplicate descriptions across pages
HTML <title> renders correctly on each page
npm run build succeeds

features.title: Create robots.txt
features.description: Add a robots.txt file that allows all crawlers and points to the sitemap. Keep it simple — no pages need to be blocked.
validationCriteria: robots.txt exists at public/robots.txt
Allows all user agents
Points to sitemap URL (https://woodswebsites.com/sitemap.xml)
Accessible at /robots.txt in dev server

features.title: Create dynamic sitemap
features.description: Create an app/sitemap.ts file using the Next.js sitemap generation API. Should list all public pages: /, /portfolio, /services, /about, /contact, /privacy, /terms. Include lastModified dates and change frequency hints.
validationCriteria: sitemap.ts exports a default function returning MetadataRoute.Sitemap
All public pages are listed with full URLs
Each entry has lastModified date
Sitemap is accessible at /sitemap.xml in dev server
Valid XML structure

features.title: Add structured data (JSON-LD)
features.description: Add JSON-LD structured data to the homepage for SEO. Include Organization schema (business name, URL, logo, contact info) and WebSite schema. Embed as a <script type='application/ld+json'> tag.
validationCriteria: Homepage contains a <script type='application/ld+json'> tag
Organization schema includes: name, url, logo, email, description
WebSite schema includes: name, url
JSON-LD is valid (test with Google Rich Results Test or Schema.org validator)
No console errors from the script tag

features.title: Create default Open Graph image
features.description: Create a default OG image (1200x630px) for social media sharing. Should feature the Woods Websites brand name, tagline, and amber/zinc color scheme. Used when pages are shared on social media without a page-specific image.
validationCriteria: Image exists at public/images/og-default.jpg
Dimensions are 1200x630px
Includes Woods Websites brand name
Uses the amber/zinc design palette
Text is legible at small preview sizes
File size is optimized (under 200KB)

features.title: Audit and fix image alt text
features.description: Review all images across the site and ensure every and tag has a descriptive, meaningful alt attribute. Replace any generic alt text (e.g., 'image', 'screenshot') with specific descriptions.
validationCriteria: Every Image component has a descriptive alt attribute
No alt text is empty string, 'image', or 'screenshot'
Alt text describes the content (e.g., 'Aviation Expeditions website homepage showing mountain landscape hero')
Decorative images use alt='' intentionally
No ESLint warnings about missing alt text

features.title: Add Cloudflare Web Analytics
features.description: Add the Cloudflare Web Analytics beacon script to the site. This can be done via a <script> tag in the root layout, or configured to auto-inject via Cloudflare Pages dashboard after deployment. If adding the script manually, use Next.js Script component with strategy='afterInteractive'.
validationCriteria: Analytics script is present in the HTML output (or documented as auto-inject via Cloudflare dashboard)
Script uses Next.js <Script> component if added manually
Script strategy is 'afterInteractive' to avoid blocking page load
No console errors from the analytics script
Analytics beacon token placeholder or actual token is configured

features.title: Create Privacy Policy page
features.description: Create a /privacy page with a standard privacy policy. Cover: what data is collected (contact form submissions only — name, email, phone, company, project details), how it's used (to respond to inquiries), third-party services (FormSubmit.co for form delivery, Cloudflare for hosting and analytics), data retention, user rights, and contact information. No cookies are used. Design as a clean, readable text page matching the site's typography system.
validationCriteria: Page exists at /privacy route
Covers all required sections: data collection, usage, third parties, retention, rights, contact
Mentions FormSubmit.co and Cloudflare by name
States no cookies are used
Page includes metadata export (title, description)
Typography consistent with rest of site
Footer privacy link works correctly
Page is readable and well-structured

features.title: Create Terms of Service page
features.description: Create a /terms page with standard terms of service. Cover: service description (web design and development), intellectual property, limitation of liability, disclaimers, governing law, and contact information. validationCriteria: Page exists at /terms route
Covers all required sections: services, IP, liability, disclaimers, governing law, contact

Typography consistent with rest of site

Page is readable and well-structured

features.title: Enable Cloudflare Web Analytics and verify
